translated: Then Somā and Sakulā went to King Pasenadi and said, “Your Majesty, please go to the Buddha and pay homage with your head at his feet in our name, asking if he is free from illness and affliction, if he is strong, healthy, and living comfortably, saying:

analyzed: upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantam abhivādetvā ekamantam nisīdi ekamantam nisinnaḥ khalu rājā
translated: King Pasenadi Kosala then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

original: “somā ca, bhante, bhaginī sakulā ca bhaginī bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchatī”ti.
analyzed: somā ca bhante bhaginī sakulā ca bhaginī bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati iti
translated: “Venerable Sir, Somā and Sakulā pay homage with their head at the Blessed One’s feet. They ask about your health, saying that you are strong, well, and living comfortably.”

original: “Assosuṁ kho, bhante, somā ca bhaginī sakulā ca bhaginī:

translated: “Sir, Somā and Sakulā heard

translated: that today King Pasenadi of Kosala would visit the Buddha after his meal.

analyzed: tena hi mahā rāja amhākam pi vacanena bhagavato pāde sirasā vandāhi appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram puccha
translated: ‘Well then, great king, pay homage to the Buddha on our behalf, saying that we are strong, well, and living comfortably,

original: somā ca bhaginī sakulā ca bhaginī bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati, appābādhaṁ appātaṅkaṁ lahuṭṭhānaṁ balaṁ phāsuvihāraṁ pucchatī’”ti.
analyzed: somā ca bhaginī sakulā ca bhaginī bhagavato pāde sirasā vandati appa ābādham appa ātaṅkam lahu ṭṭhānam balam phāsu vihāram pucchati iti
translated: and her sister Somā, and her sister Sakulā, pay homage with their head at the Blessed One’s feet and ask whether the Blessed One is free from illness and affliction, and is healthy, strong, and abiding in comfort, saying:

translated: “There is no recluse or brahmin who is omniscient and all-seeing, who can claim to have complete knowledge and vision; that is not possible.”’

translated: Those who say this, venerable sir,

analyzed: ye te mahā rāja evam āhasu samaṇaḥ gotamaḥ evam āha atthi saḥ samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ
translated: that there is no ascetic or brahmin who

analyzed: vā yaḥ sabbaññū sabba dassāvī aparisesam ñāṇa dassanam paṭijānissati na etat ṭhānam vijjati iti
translated: claims to be all-knowing and all-seeing, and to have complete knowledge and vision, and that this is impossible—

analyzed: na me te vutta vādinaḥ abbhācikkhanti ca pana mam te asatā abhūtena ati
translated: they do not report my words correctly; they misrepresent me with what is unfactual and untrue.”

translated: Then King Pasenadi addressed the general Viṭaṭūbha:

translated: “General, who started this discussion in the royal palace?”

translated: “The brahmin Sañjaya, born of the ākāsa clan.”

translated: “Please go to the brahmin Sañjaya, born of the ākāsa clan,🔽and say to him:

analyzed: rājā ta bhante pasenadi kosalaḥ āmantā iti iti

translated: “Yes, sir,” he replied. He then went to the Buddha, bowed, sat down,

translated: ‘It’s impossible for a monastic or a contemplative or a deity or a Māra or a Brahmā or anyone in the world to know or see or reach the end of the cosmos by traveling to it. original: “Heturūpaṁ, bhante, bhagavā āha; saheturūpaṁ, bhante, bhagavā āha:

analyzed: natthi so samaṇaḥ vā brāhmaṇaḥ vā yaḥ sakid eva sabbam sabbam dakkhiti na etam ṭhānam vijjati iti

translated: There are, Sir, these four castes:

original: “Dassanampi, bho, rājā pasenadi kosalo deve tāvatiṁse nappahoti, kuto pana tamhā ṭhānā cāvessati vā pabbājessati vā”ti?🔽“Evameva kho, senāpati, ye te devā sabyābajjhā āgantāro itthattaṁ te devā, ye te🔽devā abyābajjhā anāgantāro itthattaṁ te deve dassanāyapi nappahonti; kuto pana tamhā
analyzed: dassanam pi bho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ deve tāvatise na ppahoti kutas pana tamhā ṭhānā cāvessati vā pabbājessati vā ati  evam eva kho senāpati ye te devāḥ sabya ābajjhāḥ āgantāraḥ itthattam te devāḥ ye te  devāḥ a byābajjhāḥ an āgantāraḥ itthattam te deve dassanāya api na ppahonti kutas pana tamhā
translated: “Even to see the gods, King Pasenadi, is difficult, let alone to drive them out or banish them.”

original: ṭhānā cāvessanti vā pabbājessanti vā”ti?
analyzed: ṭhānā cāvessanti vā pabbājessanti vā ati
translated: “In the same way, general, those gods who are subject to affliction and have come to this state of existence are unable to see those gods who are not subject to affliction and have not come to this state of existence. Let alone driving them out or banishing them.”

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then King Pasenadi said to the Blessed One:

original: “konāmo ayaṁ, bhante, bhikkhū”ti?
analyzed: konāmaḥ bhante bhikkhu iti
translated: “What is the name of this bhikkhu, venerable sir?”

original: “Ānando nāma, mahārājā”ti.🔽“Ānando vata bho, ānandarūpo vata bho.
analyzed: ānandaḥ nāma mahā rāja ati  ānandaḥ vata bho ānanda rūpaḥ vata bho
translated: “His name is Ananda, great king.”🔽“Ananda indeed, venerable sir, he is of the nature of ananda.

original: Heturūpaṁ, bhante, āyasmā ānando āha; saheturūpaṁ, bhante, āyasmā ānando āha.
analyzed: hetu rūpa bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ āha sa hetu rūpa bhante āyasmai ānandaḥ āha
translated: He has spoken with reason, venerable sir, the venerable Ananda has spoken with reason.

original: Kiṁ pana, bhante, atthi brahmā”ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante atthi brahma ati
translated: But, venerable sir, is there a Brahma?”

original: “Kiṁ pana tvaṁ, mahārāja, evaṁ vadesi:
analyzed: kim pana tva mahā rāja evam vadesi
translated: “But, great king, why do you say this:

original: ‘kiṁ pana, bhante, atthi brahmā’”ti?
analyzed: kim pana bhante atthi brahma ati
translated: ‘But, venerable sir, is there a Brahma?’”

original: “Yadi vā so, bhante, brahmā āgantā itthattaṁ, yadi vā anāgantā itthattan”ti?
analyzed: yadi vā saḥ bhante brahmā āgantā yadi vā anāgantā
translated: “Whether that Brahmā comes to this assembly or not, he is still Brahmā.”

original: “Yo so, mahārāja, brahmā sabyābajjho so brahmā āgantā itthattaṁ, yo so brahmā abyābajjho so brahmā anāgantā itthattan”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ saḥ mahā rāja brahmā sa byābajjhaḥ saḥ brahmā āgantā yaḥ saḥ brahmā a byābajjhaḥ saḥ brahmā an āgantā
translated: “Great king, the Brahmā who is subject to affliction comes to this assembly, but the Brahmā who is not subject to affliction does not come to this assembly.”

original: Atha kho aññataro puriso rājānaṁ pasenadiṁ kosalaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho aññataraḥ purisaḥ rājānam pasenadim kosalam etat avoca
translated: Then a certain man went to King Pasenadi and whispered to him:

original: “sañjayo, mahārāja, brāhmaṇo ākāsagotto āgato”ti.
analyzed: sañjayaḥ mahā rāja brāhmaṇaḥ ākāsa gottaḥ āgataḥ iti
translated: “Great king, the brahmin Sañjaya, the son of Ratthapala, has arrived.”

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo sañjayaṁ brāhmaṇaṁ ākāsagottaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ sañjayam brāhmaṇam ākāsa gottam etat avoca
translated: Then King Pasenadi said to the brahmin Sañjaya, the son of Ratthapala:

original: “ko nu kho, brāhmaṇa, imaṁ kathāvatthuṁ rājantepure abbhudāhāsī”ti?
analyzed: kaḥ nu khalu brāhmaṇaḥ imam kathāvatthum rājantepure abbhudāhāsi iti
translated: “Brahmin, who was it that made this statement in the royal palace?”

original: “Viṭaṭūbho, mahārāja, senāpatī”ti.
analyzed: mahā rāja senāpati iti
translated: “General Viṭaṭūbho, great king.”

original: Viṭaṭūbho senāpati evamāha:
analyzed: viṭa ṭūbho senāpati evam āha
translated: General Viṭaṭūbho said:

original: “sañjayo, mahārāja, brāhmaṇo ākāsagotto”ti.
analyzed: sañjayaḥ mahā rāja brāhmaṇaḥ ākāsa gottā iti
translated: “Great king, it was the brahmin Sañjaya, the son of Ratthapala.”

original: Atha kho aññataro puriso rājānaṁ pasenadiṁ kosalaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha kho aññataraḥ purisaḥ rājānam pasenadim kosalam etat avoca
translated: Then a certain man went to King Pasenadi and whispered to him:

original: “yānakālo, mahārājā”ti.
analyzed: yāna kālaḥ mahā rāja ati
translated: “Great king, it is time to depart.”

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
analyzed: atha khalu rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ bhagavantam etat avoca
translated: Then King Pasenadi said to the Blessed One:

original: “sabbaññutaṁ mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ apucchimhā, sabbaññutaṁ bhagavā byākāsi;
analyzed: sabbaññu tam bhante bhagavantam apucchimhā sabbaññu tam bhagavā byākāsi
translated: “We asked the Blessed One about omniscience, and the Blessed One answered our question.

original: tañca panamhākaṁ ruccati ceva khamati ca, tena camhā attamanā.
analyzed: tat ca panamhākam ruccati ca iva khamati ca tena camhā atta manāḥ
translated: We approve of and accept that answer, and so we are satisfied.

original: Cātuvaṇṇisuddhiṁ mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ apucchimhā, cātuvaṇṇisuddhiṁ bhagavā byākāsi;
analyzed: cātuvaṇṇi suddhim bhante bhagavantam apucchimhā cātuvaṇṇi suddhim bhagavā byākāsi
translated: We asked the Blessed One about the purification of the four castes, and the Blessed One answered our question.

original: tañca panamhākaṁ ruccati ceva khamati ca, tena camhā attamanā.
analyzed: tat ca panamhākam ruccati ca iva khamati ca tena camhā atta manāḥ
translated: We approve of and accept that answer, and so we are satisfied.

original: Adhideve mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ apucchimhā, adhideve bhagavā byākāsi;
analyzed: adhideve bhante bhagavantam apucchimhā adhideve bhagavā
translated: We asked the Blessed One about the overlord of the gods, and the Blessed One answered our question.

original: tañca panamhākaṁ ruccati ceva khamati ca, tena camhā attamanā.
analyzed: tat ca panamhākam ruccati ca iva khamati ca tena camhā atta manāḥ
translated: We approve of and accept that answer, and so we are satisfied.

original: Adhibrahmānaṁ mayaṁ, bhante, bhagavantaṁ apucchimhā, adhibrahmānaṁ bhagavā byākāsi;
analyzed: adhibrahmānam bhante bhagavantam apucchimhā adhibrahmānam bhagavā
translated: We asked the Blessed One about the overlord of the Brahmās, and the Blessed One answered our question.

original: tañca panamhākaṁ ruccati ceva khamati ca, tena camhā attamanā.
analyzed: tat ca panamhākam ruccati ca iva khamati ca tena camhā atta manāḥ
translated: We approve of and accept that answer, and so we are satisfied.

original: Yaṁ yadeva ca mayaṁ bhagavantaṁ apucchimhā taṁ tadeva bhagavā byākāsi;
analyzed: yam yat eva ca mayam bhagavantam apucchimha tam tat eva bhagavā byākāsi
translated: Whatever we asked the Blessed One, that the Blessed One answered.

original: tañca panamhākaṁ ruccati ceva khamati ca, tena camhā attamanā.
analyzed: tat ca panamhākam ruccati ca iva khamati ca tena camhā atta manāḥ
translated: and it seems good to us too.

original: Handa ca dāni mayaṁ, bhante, gacchāma;
analyzed: handa ca dāni maya bhante gacchāma
translated: Now, Sir, we must go,

original: bahukiccā mayaṁ bahukaraṇīyā”ti.
analyzed: bahu kitcā mayam bahu karaṇīyā ati
translated: we have many duties and much work.”

original: “Yassadāni tvaṁ, mahārāja, kālaṁ maññasī”ti.
analyzed: yaḥ sadāni tva mahā rāja kālam maññasi iti
translated: “Now is the time, Great King, to do as you think fit.”

original: Atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalo bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā pakkāmīti.🔽Kaṇṇakatthalasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ dasamaṁ.
analyzed: atha kho rājā pasenadi kosalaḥ bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāya āsanā bhagavantam abhivādetvā padakkhiṇam katvā pakkāmi iti  kaṇṇakatthala suttam niṭṭhitam dasama
translated: Then King Pasenadi of Kosala, having delighted and rejoiced in the Fortunate One’s words, rising from his seat, worshipping and circumambulating the Fortunate One, went away.🔽The Discourse about Kaṇṇakatthala is finished.

original: Rājavaggo niṭṭhito catuttho.
analyzed: rāja vaggaḥ niṭṭhitaḥ catutthaḥ
translated: The Fourth Chapter is finished.

original: Tassuddānaṁ
analyzed: tassa uddāna
translated: The summary:

original: Ghaṭikāro raṭṭhapālo,
analyzed: ghaṭi kāraḥ raṭṭhapālo
translated: The Potter, the Village Overseer,

original: maghadevo madhuriyaṁ;
analyzed: magha devaḥ madhuriya
translated: Maghadeva, and the Honey-ball,

original: Bodhi aṅgulimālo ca,🔽piyajātaṁ bāhitikaṁ;
analyzed: ca  piya jātam bāhitika
translated: Bodhi, and Aṅgulimāla,🔽Piyajātika, and Bāhiya,

original: Dhammacetiyasuttañca,
analyzed: dhammacetiya suttañca
translated: The Dhamma-Cetiya Discourse,
